dublin_core.dcvalue: Recent studies have indicated that acute exposure to low level radiofrequency RF electromagnetic fields generated by mobile phones affects human cognition However the relatively small samples used in addition to methodological problems make the outcomes of these studies difficult to interpret In our study we tested a large sample of volunteers 168 using a series of cognitive tasks apparently sensitive to RF exposure a simple reaction task a vigilance task and a subtraction task Participants performed those tasks twice in two different sessions In one session they were exposed to RFs with half of subjects exposed to GSM signals and the other half exposed to CW signals while in the other session they were exposed to sham signals No significant effects of RF exposure on performance for either GSM or CW were found independent of whether the phone was positioned on the left or on the right side
Does acute exposure to mobile phones affect human attention?
